blocker.personal: Upgrade your LHM to a Personal, Professional or Enterprise plan to get full access to this section.
blocker.proPlus: Upgrade your LHM to a Professional or Enterprise plan to get full access to this section.

aco.cs2Warning:
ACO and ACO AI are not currently available for the freshly released Counter-Strike 2.
CS2 is missing key features which are required by LHM for those functionalities to work right now.
aco.cs2ScoutAndARGWarning:
Because of missing key features in CS2, {{ feature }} now requires the in-game grenade keybindings to be set to their default values (number keys 1-0 on the keyboard) in order to work correctly.

The lack of necessary commands in CS2 prevents LHM from switching players automatically, so LHM is now sending keypresses to the game manually, so please make sure the game is focused during {{ feature }} usage.
aco.areaConfigurationsPlaceholder: Select an area to see its configurations
aco.telnetWarning: To use Telnet, CS2 must be launched with Workshop Tools. You can do it by enabling "Killfeed / Tools" option in the HUDs tab and clicking "Run Game" button.
aco.disabledDescription: All control is given to you and your observers.
aco.aco1Description:
A balance of control and automation.
Assist your observers with a set of manually written instructions for ACO.
aco.aco-aiDescription: Sit back while the advanced algorithms of ACO AI control your stream.
aco.aco-ai-scoutDescription: Let our latest AI match observer system take the wheel.
aco.aco-ai-scoutDescription-disconnected: Let our latest AI match observer system take the wheel.\nScout servers may be currently unavailable.
aco.addConfigHeader: Add a new configuration to this area
aco.addConfigPlaceholder: Enter a command to be executed in this area
aco.scoutServerUnavailable:
LHM can't connect to Scout AI servers.
Please try again in a few minutes.

players.avatarInfo: Avatar to be used for player images instead of the default from Steam
players.importPlayersExcel: Use our pre-prepared Excel sheet to easily import many players at once.

teams.logoInfo: Logo to be used for the team, if possible in the given HUD
teams.importTeamsExcel: Use our pre-prepared Excel sheet to easily import many teams at once.

live.tip: Players currently in match, click to add a player to the player list.

warnings.lol-mr-1: Advanced Addon makes it possible to read much more data thanks to memory reading. Memory reading can be treated as a cheat, while such tools have existed for years and Riot does not refer to them and we have not heard of cases of spectators being banned for this. Nevertheless, you use League of Legends Advanced Addon at your own risk.
warnings.lol-mr-2: Do not use LoL Advanced Addon during normal gameplay, it is only used to spectate the game!

playerExists.overwrite: Do you want to overwrite their data with this?

error.title: Unable to add the HUD
error.config: LHM wasn't able to read the HUD's config file.
error.upload: LHM wasn't able to upload the HUD to the cloud. Try it again later.
error.generic: Something went wrong. Try it again later.
error.archive: LHM wasn't able to read the archive file.
error.space: You do not have enough Cloud Space in the workspace you're using. Please upgrade your plan or delete some of your cloud resources.

cta.tryScoutAI: Use our AI observer and multiple AI match predictions!

onlyInProPlus.title: Upgrade your plan
onlyInProPlus.info:
This functionality is only available for Professional and Enterprise plan users.
Please upgrade your plan to unlock it.

onlyInProPlusEnt3.title: Upgrade your plan
onlyInProPlusEnt3.info:
This functionality is only available for Professional and Enterprise plan users with at least 3 seats.
Please upgrade your plan to unlock it.

deviceLockWorkspace.title: Device limit exceeded
deviceLockWorkspace.info:
It seems like the workspace is being used on more devices than the amount of seats its plan has.
Wait for the device lock to expire or upgrade your Enterprise plan to accomodate more devices.

killfeedOffset.title: Killfeed Offset
killfeedOffset.info: Enabling this option will set safezoney to 0.8 to accomodate for custom HUD elements in the right top corner

premium.cs2:
With PREMIUM HUD we are taking the next step towards the goal of building the super easy to use cloud-based solution which with just a few clicks takes care of every step of esports tournament organization - including top-tier visuals!
PREMIUM HUD is available for all Personal, Professional and Enterprise Plan users.
premium.csgo:
With PREMIUM HUD we are taking the next step towards the goal of building the super easy to use cloud-based solution which with just a few clicks takes care of every step of esports tournament organization - including top-tier visuals!
PREMIUM HUD is available for all Personal, Professional and Enterprise Plan users.
premium.dota2: Premium HUD for Dota 2 is our first step into revolutionizing the MOBA broadcasting industry. Our goal was to make absolutely everyone benefit from this integration. Whether you're a newcomer to the esports scene or already have your own brand and proven solutions, we're confident that the Premium HUD will bring you an experience that neither you nor your audience have ever seen before on other broadcasts.
premium.leagueoflegends: Premium HUD for League of Legends adds what is missing from the game's observer HUD and makes things even better. A huge amount of data, additional statistics and screens, beautiful visuals integrated into the game interface create a completely new and unique experience. Premium HUD for League of Legends is a quality that can be observed at the most famous events, from now on available to everyone.
premium.rocketleague: From the beginning, we wanted to build a solution to help esports focus on esports - and make sure to utilize the vast amount of existing data esports generates for viewers, players and organizers. Once we have begun successful in that area we added automation and cloud-based to the list - to make sure organizers can focus on viewers, players and teams instead of setting everything manually and worrying if everything will work.

ultra.cs2:
Counter-Strike 2 is a new fresh start. Ultra HUD is a comprehensive overlay to meet the needs and style that CS2 brought. The quick and easy setup of Ultra HUD will adapt to your needs and completely enhance your events. Your broadcast - just like Counter-Strike - is ready for a new era.
Ultra HUD is available for all Professional LHM Plan users, as well as Enterprise Plan users with 3 or more seats.
ultra.dota2:
There was no solution on the market that provided additional information, blended into the interface from the game and was accessible to everyone with a super-easy setup. Ultra HUD for Dota 2 changed all of that. LHM's advanced support of Dota 2 over the past several months has allowed us to improve everything we've offered so far - that's how Ultra HUD came to be.
The first and biggest upgrade you'll notice is the look of the HUD - from now on, it's both versatile and perfectly complements the layout of Dota 2 but doesn't make any visual compromises. This makes Ultra HUD the perfect solution for anyone, regardless of their own branding and expectations. It is simply an almost new part of the game.

scout.title: Scout AI
scout.info: Enabling this option will launch CS2 with VConsole2, which might prevent you from joining servers unless properly configured.

tab.title: HUDs Tab
tab.info: HUDs tab is used to manage HUDs and game launch configuration.

radar.title: Radar
radar.info: Enabling this option and running the game with the config presented below or using the "Run game" button will disable the in-game radar to use the custom radar built into your HUDs.

killfeed.title: Killfeed / Tools
killfeed.info:
Enabling this option and running the game with the config presented below or using the "Run game" button will disable the in-game killfeed to use the custom killfeed built into your HUDs.
This option will launch CS2 in insecure mode - do not join VAC-protected servers (e.g. Faceit, matchmaking) unless as a GOTV spectator while it is enabled.

embeddedHUD.title: Embedded HUD
embeddedHUD.info:
Enabling this option will make LHM hook into the CS:GO render process, making your HUD a part of the game instead of a separate overlay. To launch a HUD in embedded mode, use the toggle next to the HUD.
Using embedded mode is required for AR. It might also decrease the performance of the game.
This option will launch CS:GO in insecure mode - you won't be able to join VAC-protected servers (e.g. Faceit, matchmaking) unless as a GOTV spectator while it is enabled.

playTestLoop.title: Play test loop
playTestLoop.info: Enabling this option will play the Test Data in a loop so it never ends. This is useful for testing your HUDs.

ar.title: AR
ar.info:
Enabling this option and running the game with the config presented below or using the "Run game" button will allow you to use AR modules.
This option will launch CS:GO in insecure mode - you won't be able to join VAC-protected servers (e.g. Faceit, matchmaking) unless as a GOTV spectator while it is enabled.

autoExecute.title: Auto-execute
autoExecute.info: "Run game" button will launch the game with the config presented below when this option is enabled.

xray.title: XRay
xray.info: With this option you can set custom colors for player borders in the game.

runTest.title: Run test
runTest.info: This functionality lets you simulate a game data stream to test your HUD or configuration.

launchParams.title: Launch Parameters
launchParams.info: You can specify Launch Parameters for the game here, instead of its settings in the Steam

tab.title: Teams
tab.info: Teams tab is used to manage teams displayed and used within HUDs and other LHM functionalities.

tab.title: Players
tab.info: Players tab is used to manage players displayed and used within HUDs and other LHM functionalities.

tab.title: Matches
tab.info: Matches tab is used to manage matches displayed and used within HUDs and other LHM functionalities.

tab.title: Tournaments
tab.info: Tournaments tab is used to manage tournaments displayed and used within HUDs and other LHM functionalities.

tab.title: CG Mode
tab.info:
CG Mode incorporates the most essential modules for broadcasting operations in a compact form.
From this tab, you can manage your matches, teams, players and live game on a single screen.
You can hide unnecessary tabs using the "Hide" button above each section.

tab.title: Auto Replay Generator
tab.info:
Auto Replay Generator (ARG) module generates replays that can be displayed between rounds or at the end of a game.
Please keep in mind that vMix is required for proper ARG configuration. vMix is not a free application, and ARG itself is designed primarly for production teams already using vMix.

safeband.title: Safeband
safeband.info: Safeband options determine how much time (in milliseconds) before and after a kill each clip should contain.

useHLAE.title: Use HLAE?
useHLAE.info: Using HLAE will let ARG analyze more in-game data, resulting in better kill predictions.

delayConfig.title: Delay config
delayConfig.info: Delay config specifies how much the GOTV observer is delayed (in seconds).

saveClips.title: Save clips
saveClips.info: Enabling this option will make vMix keep all of the clips generated by ARG instead of deleting them.

computerID.title: Computer ID
computerID.info: ID used by ARG, needed for successful connection.

telnet.title: Telnet
telnet.info: Telnet is a protocol for communication with CS2. While it is being used, you don't need to have CS2 window in focus, as LHM will switch players with remote commands.

tab.title: Auto Cinematic Observer
tab.info:
The ACO module lets you use predefined camera movement paths to follow the action in the game.
ACO uses AI to determine the most important events happening in-game at any given time.

area.title: Area
area.info:
Areas are regions on the map to which you bind your configs. If there are many players in the given area, one of the configs added to it will be executed inside the CS:GO client.
To add an area, click on the "+" button and select the desired region on the map by clicking on its corners.

manualControl.title: Manual control
manualControl.info:
Use the Manual Control panel to pick any area to be displayed by hand.
Because this is an external page that opens up in your web browser, you can visit it from your smartphone or tablet as well (if you are in the same local network).
Clicking or tapping on an area inside the Manual Control panel will execute its configs in the CS:GO client.

areaCreation.title: Area creation
areaCreation.info:
Click on the map to define the corners of your area.
Use the undo button if you made a mistake.

directorSwitch.title: Enable Director
directorSwitch.info: When the toggle is turned on, the ACO automatically starts up. You can also use keybind (default: ALT + K).

scoutDirectorSwitch.title: Enable Director
scoutDirectorSwitch.info: When the toggle is turned on, the Scout AI automatically starts up. You can also use keybind (default: ALT + K).

scoutCinematic.title: Scout AI Cinematic Mode
scoutCinematic.info:
In this mode, Scout AI will work along with ACO AI, to provide the fullest observing experience. Without it, Scout AI will only provide POV camera, without any overview shots.
This mode is only applicable if ACO AI supports a map the match is played on.

scoutPredict.title: Scout Predict
scoutPredict.info: Scout allows for automated, AI-based live predictions. If this option is enabled, those predictions will be sent to your HUDs on important moments, to give better insight into a game.

timeRemaining.title: Your monthly Scout AI quota
timeRemaining.info: Your available time to use Scout AI servers. It refreshes with every month of your subscription.

tab.title: Augmented Reality
tab.info:
AR module support allows for displaying custom 3D objects as if they were a part of the game.
AR uses camera position data loaded using GSI to render your HTML & CSS-based 3D objects over the game scene.

tab.title: Live
tab.info:
When a live game is detected, the Live tab fills up with data about the current match, such as player names, IDs and current score.
The Live tab provides you with quick access to player editing as well.

tab.title: Cameras
tab.info: The Cameras module lets you display player webcam feeds inside your HUDs using LHM - no external tools are required.

tab.title: Addons
tab.info:
Addons are a new way to create powerful integrations with LHM, working by providing sandboxed Node.js environments with CS:GO GSI event emitters hooked into them out of the box.
Thanks to LHM Addons, you can focus your efforts on creating the best possible experience for your viewers, with all the heavy lifting done by LHM.

tab.title: Quick
tab.info: LHM Quick allows you to quickly prepare your whole player, team and HUD setup from a single place, letting you get your stream started right away.

imageTooLarge.title: Image too large
imageTooLarge.info: The selected image is too large. The size limit is {{limit}} MB.

delete.infoTeams: Are you sure you want to remove {{count}} teams?
delete.infoPlayers: Are you sure you want to remove {{count}} players?

steamApiKeyMissing.title: Steam API Key Missing
steamApiKeyMissing.info: It seems you put custom Steam URL in the SteamID field. LHM requires Steam API Key to support custom URLs. Do you wish to save anyway?

cloudification.updateModalTitle: Upload your HUDs to LHM Cloud
cloudification.updateModalInfo1: Starting with LHM 4.9.0, all HUDs are fully cloud-based. This means that you are now able to use your HUDs on any device, and your HUDs will always stay in-sync.
cloudification.updateModalInfo2: To continue using LHM, you need to upload your HUDs to LHM Cloud.
cloudification.updateModalCloudWarning: Some of the HUDs are currently saved compressed in the Cloud. To use them, LHM will have to download them and decompress them. It may result in higher Cloud limit usage.
cloudification.updateModalNonuploadedHUDsStillInDirecto: Your HUDs will still be backed up in your HUD directory, if you choose not to upload them.
cloudification.updateModalImporting: We're preparing your HUDs for you...

actions.uploadAll: Upload all HUDs to LHM Cloud
actions.customize: Let me choose which HUDs to upload

welcome.title: Welcome to LHM!
welcome.description: New to LHM? Here you will find some basic tips to get started with using the application!

games.title: Game configuration
games.description:
LHM currently supports CS2, Dota 2, League of Legends, Rocket League, Apex Legends and F1. Each supported game requires a simple but necessary configuration to work properly with LHM.
Click on the Learn More button below to learn how to set up any game you want to use with LHM.

quick.title: LHM Quick
quick.description:
LHM Quick allows you to quickly configure players and teams to launch with HUD. The feature is primarily intended for users familiar with how LHM works and to allow them to get started right away.
Currently, the games that are supported in LHM Quick are CS2, CS:GO, Dota 2, League of Legends and Rocket League.
Click on the Learn More button below to learn more about LHM Quick.

huds.title: HUDs tab
huds.description:
The HUDs tab displays all the HUDs you have, both the built-in ones and the ones you have uploaded yourself.
To start a HUD, you can launch the overlay in a separate window on your system ("Start HUD overlay" button) or copy the link and add it as a browser source in your broadcast software ("Toggle HUD url" button).

lhmHuds.title: LHM HUDs
lhmHuds.description:
Each LHM plan has built-in HUDs. The higher the plan, the more advanced the HUDs. Click on the names below to learn more about each:

- Default HUD for any supported game
- Premium HUD for [[CS2|premiumCS2]], [[Dota 2|premiumDota2]], [[LoL|premiumLoL]], [[Rocket League|premiumRL]]
- Ultra HUD for [[CS2|ultraCS2]] and [[Dota 2|ultraDota2]]

userGuide.title: User guide
userGuide.description: Check out our User Guide to learn more about each of LHM's components. You'll find descriptions, instructions for configuring and using all features, and answers to the most common questions. If you have additional questions, join [[our Discord|discord]].
